TopicTitle: Hype Train 1.0.5: The Local Train Route

Articles.Content: What color is hype so you can color me hyped?

We're still left with a rocket that looks to be overpowered and too efficient. If they don't rebalance it, it will break the game.

That's quite an easy fix. Make its cost dissuasive for an expendable use.
I am now very hyped. The 1.0.5 cinematic trailer really got me on board. HYPE!

Tiny drills HYPE activated!

Plane stuff HYPE activated!

Radiator and thermal improvements HYPE activated!

Hype Mode Engage

HYPE!

Edited November 8, 2015 by Sanic

Cant wait The new Jet Engines are what I'm waiting on.

P.S. Only two youtube videos?? Wish i could've watched the streams yesterday but twitch hates my internet.
We're going off the rails on a hyping train dunadunadunadunanananadunananana *guitar solo*

Wish i could've watched the streams yesterday but twitch hates my internet.

Can you at least watch the archived VOD's of the KSPTV marathon streams or is Twitch entirely a no-go whether or not it's live?

Can you at least watch the archived VOD's of the KSPTV marathon streams or is Twitch entirely a no-go whether or not it's live?

Where do i go to do that?

Where do i go to do that?

Go the profile page of KSPTV - http://www.twitch.tv/ksptv/profile - and choose a video with 1.0.5 in the title

YEAH! HYPE!

*stuff that's not in all caps*

Go the profile page of KSPTV - http://www.twitch.tv/ksptv/profile - and choose a video with 1.0.5 in the title

Thanks It worked well, It would be nice if there was a link from the ksptv main page to the profile page, but it worked.
The worst part about waiting for an update is that I WANT to play KSP, however whatever I do in it will have to be scrapped once the long awaited update comes out. Whatever, HYPEEE!

Strap on some more RT-10 boosters to the hype train!

HYPE!!!

Can't wait to get my hands on that MK3 cargo ramp!

Hype!

On the offhand chance we discuss features in here, does anyone know if we can use multiple claws on the same asteroid yet? as in a giant triopod with claws on each prong?

Its been a long while since I played with asteroids, and I was wondering if we can yet. If not, will that be a 1.1 thing?
NathanKell said yesterday that they took out many bugs around the claws behaviour in 1.0.5 so Fingers crossed.
Couldn't you already use multiple claws anyway? Saw pics of people putting on wings/wheels/engines and flying asteroids around on kerbin.

I have a very good feeling about this..

Happy landings!

Couldn't you already use multiple claws anyway? Saw pics of people putting on wings/wheels/engines and flying asteroids around on kerbin.

You can do that, because those all branch off the asteroid separately, but to have 1 craft grab the asteroid from 2 places at once did not work. Its hard to explain without visual aids.

Well, I am not really all that hyped, consider me the guy in the caboose...

Anyway, I did not see any in-depth discussion about the updated heat model. Did they do this in any of the streams?

I mean, in 1.0 we had a lot of heat and no radiators, in 1.0.4 we have a lot of radiators and no heat.

Do we finally get reasonable heat with radiators in 1.0.5?

I am certainly hyped. The devnotes from two weeks ago ensured that.

All I can say now is...

That's no patch - that's an update!

Happy landings!

You can do that, because those all branch off the asteroid separately, but to have 1 craft grab the asteroid from 2 places at once did not work. Its hard to explain without visual aids.

Nah, now I see what you mean.^^
I desperately need that new mini ISRU and drill for my next project

How's everyone feel about a quick trip to space before you all disappear into the wasteland?

Posted by Maxmaps on twitter. A HINT?

You can do that, because those all branch off the asteroid separately, but to have 1 craft grab the asteroid from 2 places at once did not work. Its hard to explain without visual aids.

I doubt that's the kind of thing that would be fixed without announcement. I think it would basically require restructuring the entire docking system to allow multiple connection points, and the way ships are handled internally to accommodate having multiple paths between parts. I really don't think that would be a simple fix, as it would potentially affect many different systems such as fuel flow.
